marketNews.title: OPEC+ Delays Meeting to 5 December 2024
marketNews.content: OPEC+ announced that it will postpone its scheduled meeting on oil production from 1 December 2024 to 5 December 2024 because several member‑state ministers will attend the Gulf Cooperation Council meeting in Kuwait. According to a Bloomberg report, OPEC usually changes the meeting date when more time is needed to finalize an agreement. The upcoming OPEC+ meeting will discuss whether to continue the supply recovery, with an initial step of increasing oil production by 180,000 barrels per day in January 2025. Delegates have begun discussions to delay the step, which could be extended for several months.

marketNews.title: Minister Signals No Fuel Subsidy for Ride‑Hailing Services
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, signaled that online ride‑hailing services (ojol) will not be granted permission to consume subsidised fuel such as Pertalite, as the service is considered a commercial activity. However, Bahlil said drivers can still receive the subsidy if they meet the eligibility criteria.

marketNews.title: Harbolnas 2024 Transaction Target Expected to Grow 13‑16% YoY
marketNews.content: The Directorate General of Trade, represented by Moda Simatupang, said the government targets a 13‑16% year‑on‑year increase in transaction value for the 2024 National Online Shopping Day (Harbolnas) compared with 2023, despite a slowdown in consumer purchasing power. The target is based on the strong growth of Harbolnas in previous years, with transaction value rising from IDR 9.1 trillion in 2019 to IDR 25.7 trillion in 2023. Harbolnas 2024 will be held from 10 to 16 December 2024.

marketNews.title: Government to Cut Domestic Airfare Prices by 10% for Holiday Season
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Transportation’s spokesperson, Elba Damhuri, announced that the government has agreed to lower domestic airline ticket prices by 10% for all airports across Indonesia. The fare reduction will be in effect during the Christmas and New Year period from 19 December 2024 to 3 January 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Aims for 605,000 bpd Oil Lifting in 2025, Optimistic on 2024 Target
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia said the government is optimistic it can meet or exceed the 2025 oil‑lifting target of 605,000 barrels per day. He explained the target could be achieved through three ways: technology intervention in existing wells, encouraging production from already explored wells, and new exploration. While optimistic about the 2025 target, he cautioned that the 2024 target of 635,000 barrels per day cannot be guaranteed.

marketNews.title: Government to Review PSN Status for PIK 2 Project
marketNews.content: The Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning, Nusron Wahid, said President Prabowo Subianto will review the designation of the Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) project as a National Strategic Project (PSN). The review will assess whether the 1,700‑hectare coastal tourism area complies with the regional spatial plan, while the final decision will be made by the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs and the President. The residential component will not be part of the PSN designation.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Discusses Nuclear Power Cooperation with US and Russia
marketNews.content: The Deputy for National Development Planning (Bappenas), Vivi Yulaswati, said Indonesia is in talks with the United States and Russia on nuclear power technology. The government is considering operating a nuclear power plant as early as 2036 to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and is open to both small modular reactors and conventional nuclear technology.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Announces Dividend and PUPS AADI Details
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) announced on Friday 29 November that the dividend per share is IDR 1,358, representing a 37% yield based on the cum‑date price of IDR 3,670 per share on 26 November 2024. The dividend amount is close to the analyst’s estimate of IDR 1,359 per share and is sufficient to cover the cost of exercising the PUPS for AADI, excluding a 0.18% transaction fee charged by Trimegah Sekuritas as underwriter. The stock was locked in an auto‑reject bottom at IDR 2,070 before closing down 24.6% to IDR 2,080, indicating the price decline since the cum date exceeds the dividend amount. Investors could benefit more by using the dividend to participate in the AADI PUPS, as the AADI share price could appreciate, whereas non‑participants would miss out on the thermal coal business valued at 2.7× 1H24 annualised P/E, below the five‑year historical mean and peers. The redemption period is expected to be 7‑10 December 2024 with distribution on 10‑11 December; the latest cut‑off is 10:00 WIB each trading day, with any exercise after that processed the next trading day.

tickerNews.title: AADI PUPS Pricing, Redemption Window and Transaction Fee
tickerNews.content: The PUPS for AADI is priced between IDR 5,546 and IDR 5,960 per share, calculated as the volume‑weighted average price (VWAP) of AADI shares after the first day of trading on 5 December 2024. The floor price is the fair value of IDR 5,546 per share, while the ceiling is 107.5% of that value, i.e., IDR 5,960. The calculation aligns with the analyst’s estimate of a range of IDR 5,550‑5,950. The transaction fee for exercising the PUPS is 0.18% charged by Trimegah Sekuritas. The redemption window is 7‑10 December 2024, with share distribution on 10‑11 December; the cut‑off time is 10:00 WIB each trading day, and any exercise after the cut‑off is processed on the next trading day.

tickerNews.title: BMRI 10M24 Net Profit Grows 6.3% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri reported a net profit (bank‑only) of IDR 4.1 trillion for October 2024, down 11% year‑on‑year and 26% month‑on‑month, resulting in a 10‑month (10M) net profit of IDR 43.1 trillion, a 6.3% year‑on‑year increase. Credit growth for 10M24 was +23% YoY (vs. +22% YoY in 9M24), above the FY24 management guidance of +16‑18% YoY. Net interest margin stayed at 4.6% in October 2024 despite tightening liquidity (LDR ~95%); the 10M24 NIM remained at 4.6% versus 5% in 10M23. Provisions rose in October, pushing credit cost to 0.9% (vs. 0.6% in Oct 2023 and –0.16% in Sep 2024); 10M24 credit cost stayed at 0.7% (‑2 bps YoY), below the FY24 guidance of ≤1%.

tickerNews.title: PANI Discusses $5 Trillion Capex Plan for Port, Convention Centre and F1 Circuit
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) CEO Sugianto Kusuma (also known as Aguan) told Bloomberg that the company is negotiating with Chinese and Singaporean partners to build a port at PIK 2, though he declined to give further details. He indicated that PANI may need more than IDR 5 trillion in capex in 2025 for the expansion, which includes Indonesia’s largest convention centre, a five‑star global hotel, and a Formula 1‑grade race circuit.

tickerNews.title: MD Entertainment Plans 10% Rights Issue Worth ~IDR 989.8 Million
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment announced a rights issue of approximately 989.8 million shares (10% of the company) that would dilute existing shareholders by 9.09%. The issue price and ratio were not disclosed; proceeds will be used for general liquidity, capital expenditures, working capital and business development. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 2 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Secures IDR 1 Trillion Joint Financing Facility
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara, through its subsidiaries PT Profesional Telekomunikasi Indonesia, PT iForte Solusi Infotek, Solusi Tunas Pratama (SUPR) and Inti Bangun Sejahtera (IBST), signed a joint financing facility agreement for a total of IDR 1 trillion with Bank Syariah Indonesia. The facility will have a 60‑month maturity from the date of disbursement, and the borrowers will be jointly and severally liable for repayment.

tickerNews.title: ABMM Acquires First Coal Mine, Plans Second Acquisition
tickerNews.content: ABM Investama’s director Hans Cristian Manoe said the company has acquired one coal mine in 2024 and is finalising the purchase of a second mine, with the second acquisition expected to be announced in December 2024 and the transaction to close in 1Q25. ABMM has already realised 70% of its 2024 capex allocation of USD 150‑200 million, focusing on expanding its mining‑contractor services.

tickerNews.title: CMRY Shareholder Sells 8.2 Million Shares at IDR 5,500
tickerNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY) shareholder Wenzel Sutantio sold approximately 8.2 million shares at an average price of IDR 5,500 per share on 22 November 2024, amounting to roughly IDR 45 billion. After the transaction, his ownership fell from 7.18% to 7.08%.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Plans Sale of Minority Toll Road Assets and Jatiluhur Water Supply
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) Secretary Mahendra Vijaya said the company plans to continue selling several minority‑interest toll road assets, including the Balikpapan‑Samarinda and Soreang‑Pasirkoja toll roads. The company also intends to sell its 88.38% stake in the Jatiluhur water supply system in East Bekasi. No specific sale price was disclosed, but the divestments are expected to be completed by the end of 2024 or in 1Q25. WIKA will focus on its core business in the coming years and will not pursue further expansion to improve liquidity and cash flow.
